",t(a.p,{children:"In the vast sea of React, where components swim freely and side-effects lurk in the depths, a developer must become a skilled fisherman to catch their desired functionality. This guide will equip you with the React Hooks you need to catch components with precision and grace."}),"

This Hook lets you perform side effects in your components, such as fetching data or subscribing to services. It's like casting your line into the water and waiting for a bite."]}),"
"]}),"
",t(a.figure,{"data-rehype-pretty-code-figure":"",children:t(a.pre,{style:{backgroundColor:"#24292e",color:"#e1e4e8"},tabIndex:"0","data-language":"jsx","data-theme":"github-dark",children:n(a.code,{"data-language":"jsx","data-theme":"github-dark",style:{display:"grid"},children:[n(a.span,{"data-line":"",children:[t(a.span,{style:{color:"#B392F0"},children:"useEffect"}),t(a.span,{style:{color:"#E1E4E8"},children:"(() "}),t(a.span,{style:{color:"#F97583"},children:"=>"}),t(a.span,{style:{color:"#E1E4E8"},children:" {"})]}),"

title: React Hooks: Fishing for Components in the React Sea
